reviews_data.review_text: I come here every year with my company for a Christmas party and we end up spending thousands here as an organization. I came here tonight thinking that I would be treated with respect and courtesy like I am with my company HOWEVER THAT IS NOT THE CASE. A bartender decided to become belligerent and rude with a friend of mine. We had a hard time the whole time getting his attention and when I finally got it he was incredibly rude to my friend. I was not accepting of this treatment. And demanded an apology and the bartender refused and the subsequently didn't serve my friend. I have the right of mind to stay until closing and talk to him about his behavior. People need to think before acting.

Favorite food menu in South End!

Plus they make a killer Red Bull Vodka
The original Resident Culture ruined MCC. This one continues the ruination of southend. Fiddlesticks!

Service was fast and the space is very comfortable and airy. I definitely recommend the latte brulee with vanilla and sugar. I also got the Brazilian bowl with pulled pork. I felt like there could've been a bit more meat for the extra 3$ and it's sorta scrambled in so you don't really know how much you've getting but otherwise very nice experience.

Food is decent. Enviorment is great. Service was bad.

Came to have some food and a drink and it was a good time. Food was decent. We got the 3 meat plate and some chicken wings. Brisket, pulled pork, and chicken quarter were all good. Chicken wings had good flavor but we're a bit soggy to be "extra crispy". Fried corn and onion rings were both great.

The place is awesome. Red lights and decorations all over. It's very spacious too with beer pong games that you can play.

I have to say I was disappointed with the service. When we arrived we stood at the door aimlessly because despite them having a hostess table and menus there was no one to great us at the front and no sign to seat ourselves. After that no words were said to us. We got our food and drinks through a QR code we scanned. When we recieved them there relatively no interactions. No one checked up on how the food was. There was atleast 4 people working the floor too but they stood in the corner talking on their phones. I was very disappointed in all of this.

Overall, the food was standard, enviorment was fun, service was well below average.

A very nice bar and grill. We celebrated my son-in-law's birthday in their private room.  The food and service were great for such a large group. I recommend this place. The only downer is you have to pay for parking.
Love it be bck
Dianna was a great host and thanks to Ed  for the amazing bbq, very passionate about what he does
Great spot to get some drinks and listen to music

Ordered the killer breakfast sandwich with avocado. The sandwich itself was excellent but the sweet potato chips were meh... not that crispy and some had an aftertaste like maybe old grease?... beer was very good. I had the future sight hazy ipa and I've had lightening drops in the past, had a taste of the sorte(altbeer) and it was quite good.. all 3 solid beers! They also serve wine and cocktails!
Continually a great spot for events. Been for large and small events now both upstairs and downstairs. Thief with the space. Great good, drink, and service every time.
A great place to have a breakfast business meeting. Great coffee, breakfast sandwiches, music and atmosphere. Lots of space for a group meeting.

One of the best brewery/dining experiences I've had in a while.  Angel was our server and was very knowledgeable about the menu and provided excellent service.  Food and drinks were fantastic and I'm glad I found a place that knows how to take care of customers and provide a great experience. Definitely will be back!

No place is perfect. Growing pains in Charlotte created workforce shortage with wait staff, but leadership/management at Resident Culture (Charlie) handled slowdowns with grace. #GreatLeadership
Food and drinks were great. Will go back again. Love the White Lavender Cappuccino and IPAs
Such an amazing experience! Check this brewery out if you're interested in awesome beer, friendly staff, a great atmosphere, and games like beer pong and corn hole!

Atmosphere was friendly and staff were very attentive. The beers are awesome, we especially liked Forever Alone and Lightning Drops. Beer pong and corn hole were both available as well. Both a patio and comfortable indoor seating.

We did not get food here. We worked a market in the basement. I liked working an event indoors with air conditioning. People had trouble finding their way downstairs. The beers were awesome. I liked the ESB. The speakeasy is very cool. Excellent place to have summer popup so both the vendors and customers can stay cool.

We had our rehearsal dinner in the Gilded Cellar here for our wedding and were super impressed! The space was spacious and the rental price was very reasonable. Sydney was wonderful in helping us make the event perfect and was attentive to each request, including crafting a special drink menu. We were relieved to find them because our previous rehearsal dinner venue shut down without notice. We heard great feedback from our guests who really enjoyed the space.

This is more of a bar/club vibe than brewery. My 6 months pregnant wife, 18 month old daughter and me went around 3 o'clock and the music was super explicit and so loud. You had to order with a waitress, who was super great, but still weren't able to order at the bar. We went there because they claim to be the only brewery in Charlotte to have NA beer on tap, but they didn't have anything. It was all around not my kind of place, but I get it if someone else likes the vibe, just not my vibe. The Hazy IPA I had was really good though.
Horrible experience. Would not recommend this place.
Everyone who works here is really nice and helpful. The smoked BBQ chicken sandwich was fire. Good place to eat
Super cool spot and great beer. LGBT friendly.
Came here for trivia night with some friends. Are some great food and had a great time.

We went in for dinner and beer before a concert, and it was all delicious. We had breakfast and coffee the next morning after hotel breakfast fail and everything was so wonderful...but the excellent service and kind management took it over the top! wonderful experience.
Resident Culture has a Brazilian chef, pretty cool bar and the chef is cool

I woke up with a craving for BBQ brisket, always on the lookout for local spots I've yet to try. A few months back, Resident Culture swapped their taco trailer for American BBQ, led by Brazilian pitmaster Edmar Simoes, making it my destination of choice today. I arrived at around 12:30 pm on a Sunday, the crowd still sparse, likely indulging in brunch before their South End drinking escapades. Settling at the spacious bar, bartender Angel offered sincere advice on the menu, recommending garlic butter chicken wings or the smoked chicken egg roll. Yet, my heart was set on brisket, my go-to gauge for BBQ joints, leading me to order the smoked brisket sandwich ($14) with a couple of pickle slices, onion and a choice of white or red slaw.

The sandwich was promptly served, the sliced smoked brisket meat was lukewarm, nestled in a brioche bun accompanied by sliced onions and pickles. Unfortunately, it fell short of expectations--lacking in fat, the meat was dry, and without any BBQ sauce provided. Angel informed me that the choice fattier cuts weren't available. Among the three BBQ sauce options--eastern Carolina vinegar, house BBQ, or Carolina mustard--I found the house BBQ sauce essential to moisten the dry brisket. While the smoked brisket had a pleasant taste, the brioche bun was unremarkable, and the side of white slaw, although satisfactory, was modestly portioned in a two-ounce souffle cup

While the meal itself was underwhelming, the interaction with Angel and his welcoming demeanor was a silver lining. If a return visit occurs, I may venture into the pulled chicken or pork, optimistic for a more fulfilling experience.
Great beer, great food and popular destination.
The food was ok.. Its a place for adults under 30...

Sadly, I was not impressed by this place at all. Thankfully my drink was good and the initial ordering process was simplified by a kind barista, but it took a long time when no one else had ordered and the line was empty. Employees were talking to each other over my shoulder instead of paying attention to their clientele, and the barista had a good 3-5 minute conversation with someone before starting my drink. This is connected to Resident Culture, which I did not try, but I had no desire to come back. Perk? If it's your first time there, they give you a card for a free drink the next time you visit. Their tables are in large stalls, so if you need privacy, this is a good choice.
We loved every bit of time spent here. The food is great & the atmosphere is even better.
Went there mid afternoon and was relatively quiet for a client meeting. Coffee was good, but can imagine this place does great in the mornings/evenings.

The food here was delicious until recently when the menu changed to Bbq. It's still okay , just not the same at the old menu . There is an event space and the ambiance is attractive and very LGBTQ+ friendly!

I just ordered a breakfast burrito for lunch (crazy, huh?) I have to say it was about as perfect tasting as any that I've ever experienced.  Their 'Killer Coffee' iced blend is also excellent.  Keep up the great work people, I will definitely be back! Thank you...

This is our second time visiting this location. We didn't have a great experience the first time and decided to try it a second time. Paid 15 dollars to park and stayed about 20 minutes. There was about 10 people there and the male bartender looked at us like it was an inconvenience to even be there. We had to order our food through the app that is located at the table. Once our food and drinks were brought to the table we wanted to add a sprite to the order and again had to get back on the app to order a sprite. Just not the friendliest atmosphere. Love the location on Central Ave and will be back to that one anytime.
Menu could be a little bit bigger, have more items on it. But the brisket and Mac & cheese are delicious. Good beers too

I don't write a lot of reviews but this place is awesome as a remote work spot. I always thought it was just a brewery but it's a coffee shop and restaurant too (thanks for the tip, Axios). The coffee is great, the food is wayyyy better than I ever expected (whether you order the new BBQ options or the coffee shop options) but the service and welcoming atmosphere blew me away. If you work remotely you know it can be hard to find a place where you feel like you aren't stealing space from other customers. This place has plenty of space, outlets, the staff has always been incredibly nice, you can order from your table (nice so you don't have to leave your crap unattended), and they actually encouraged me to work from there. Internet is a little slow but nothing using a phone hotspot can't fix it you need to do video calls. Every time I go here they treat me like we're friends. 100/10 recommend
Great fun place with a wonderful atmosphere and lots of very nice employees!!
Some of the best beers in Charlotte. Great service, open atmosphere. $15 for a flights seems a bit pricey.
Loved it! Best Swifties gathering Ever!
Great Place! Beer is good! Food is good! Everything there is awesome. Great place to chill
Great bar! Food was tasty and the service was fast!

Service is lacking when it comes to the taco bar-  they randomly just drop food on tables without actually giving it to the person who orders it/  food needs to be handed directly to the paying customer-   Shouldn't have to go back up an hour later asking where the food is to be told they handed it to someone else
Good beer and atmosphere.
Great tacos! both the beef and pork are fantastic
Come here for coffee and breakfast! 10/10. The breakfast tacos and breakfast sandwich have to be the best in Charlotte, and my latte was delicious
Went in for a cup of coffee and was not disappointed!
Cool spot, they were even generous enough to stay open a bit after their normal closing time on a Monday afternoon so we could have a few pours.
Tacos were a great Lunch

Resident Culture is my place of choice for dancing. Yes..  dancing. I have yet to try the food here but I've heard that it's really good. I go to RC almost every other Saturday when it turns into a nightclub but without the "traditional" nightclub feel so to speak. Vibes are great, awesome music (different DJ's with a variety of genres) even live music sometimes. Hard working Bartenders and tight security. I typically go out solo but the security at RC helps me to feel safe while I'm there.  I go for about 3hrs to dance for my cardio. It's been my favorite spot to have fun and workout at the same time.
They gone back to having a wait staff. I really like the trivia on Wednesday night.

We walked over to Killer Coffee while waiting for a table to open up at Ruby Slipper Cafe and we're so glad we did! The caramel late I had was SO good. Staff was super friendly and the drinks came out very fast.
Cute place with everything from coffee/pastries to lunch. Delicious tacos, bowls, coffee and matcha latte! Would definitely visit again!

Tacos were fast and delicious. Beer is always amazing. The atmosphere is cool but the DJ was stupid loud. The whole QR ordering process is a little bit sketchy.  Many wrong orders that were done online or delivered to the wrong people. Strange.

Expect a different vibe from the original Plaza Midwood location, but the beers are usually the same on rotation.
Good Music - Good Coffee- And can order outside food over.
Place was ok cashless bar it was comedy nite on my bay an comedy show was ok as well, different experience

Our first time there it was trivia night. The bar service was great and efficient. The beers we had were excellent. The facility was nice and acoustics were good. We could actually talk. The food was great and although my order had errors, they balanced out. Trivia was awesome. Nice crowd. Will be back.
Ok drinks and so so food
Very nice place! They have morning coffee and tacos, drinking throughout the day, and it kinda becomes a club at night esp. weekend nights.

Yesterday just hosted a team meeting in one of the extra rooms at Resident Culture and were blown away.  They had plenty of space in the place is very cleaned.  Killer Coffee was amazing and gave our group an extra charge to be attentive during our meeting.  Also the food was slammin!!  Ive many times to this venue and as always the staff was friendly and ready to go above and beyond.  WIsh I could give 10 stars to them Cheers to you RC!
Odd type of place that's a restaurant, beer on tap, that turns into a club later in the night. But the tacos are very good here, beer and cocktails aren't bad.
One of my favorite breweries in Charlotte. And don't forget Killer Coffee is in there too!

Ruby sunshine was on a wait next door for brunch so we came to Killer coffee to get a coffee while we waited. You are missing out if you don't get a latte here. Oh my goodness - I got the caramel oat milk latte and it was perfection!
Great vibes, great beer!!
Seems like a decent spot. Doesn't take cash with no mention on the website or anywhere else in plain view. Won't go back.
Loved getting coffee here in the morning! Spacious, relaxed atmosphere, lovely range of music, very kind and welcoming team. Need to come back and try one of their enormous cookies!
Tashi did an awesome job! Keep up the good work!

I'm not sure you can visit Charlotte Uptown and skip over this. If you did, you're doing an absolute disservice to yourself. We were in town for a concert and of course, when in rome, drink beer. We made our way down to Resident Culture a little early, about 30 minutes before the bar actually opened but when we walked through the door we were immediately greeted with genuine hospitality and offered to go ahead and get a beer early. Don't have to tell us twice. As usual, we went with the stout and a hazy IPA and we then had the argument that this was the best stout I've had since Norse Brewing came out with Phat Thor. Incredible atmosphere in this place. We finished our beer and on the way out we couldn't skip the coffee bar that in the back (NEXT TO TACOS). The coffee was just as good. If we're in the area again, we'll for sure be back.
The live music was a local artist.  I had the meatballs and fries which were the perfect pair
Great food menu, and excellent service from Eric!
Eric was fantastic! They handled our large group with multiple tabs flawlessly.
I always have a good time but nesrly $20 for a vodka red bull is insanity . I'll stick to other stuff here.

Easily in the top 3 CLT breweries. Tacos/nachos here are solid. Lots of space, patio, carry out cans. Not easy to find in SE, kinda gotta know where it is and what you're looking for. Just a tap room, they don't brew onsite.
If you like diversity, high energy and great drinks then Resident Culture is the place to be.
Great Service and delicious Vegan tacos!
Food is okay, beer selection is great. Brunch Drag shows here are worth attending!
Great atmosphere
Younger crowd, loud, fun, good food and drinks. Later, there can be a wait to get in.
Nice pregame or post sports game spot to chill and grab a cold beer and good food. The tacos here are awesome!

The bartender way overcharged me. My tab should have been $75 and she charged me $120. I asked the manager to review the transaction, very apologetic and polite because I wasn't trying to be a Karen. I felt bad, I just wanted it to be resolved. The manager was standoffish and "took down my email address" to email me about the refund. Obviously with no intention to ever email me or to help me with the situation. I wanted to be nice about it, but when she never emailed me (obviously) I just had to warn y'all. Check your tabs or first and foremost just don't go there.

The entire staff was super friendly this morning when I came in with my toddler to get to-go food. The attendant who rang in my food helped me order something with my gluten allergy. Both the breakfast tacos and the coffee were fantastic! We will be back.
Good and beer are on point

Y'all are sleeping on the food here, and I don't know why. It's all amazing, & if you get Becca is your server, you're in for a great time. Menu isn't well planned and not crowded. Everything is fantastic. Some of the best ceviche I've had in recent memory, and definitely this far inland. I didn't realize it was going to be served on tostadas, but wow, was I impressed. Should have been eating it this way all along. Obviously, it's a brewery first, and a darn good'n at that. They've curated a great environment where you can relax or party. Speaking of parties, I highly recommend the event space for reservation downstairs. It boasts a full bar, two full bathrooms, and ample space for most gatherings.

Amplio, buen servicio y buena musica la comida de buen sabor un poco costoso en comparacion.

Spacious, good service and good music, good-tasting food, a little expensive.
the vibes were good
Food is decent but way over priced for the portions. Ambiance is great
Amazing experience! The food and drinks were excellent! This was my first drag show and i was soo impresses!

Not sure her name, but our blonde bartender with the beanie was so personable and didn't get annoyed with my 1000 questions about the menu and merch. We came back the next day to retrieve a lost wallet and she was incredibly helpful.
we had the most amazing tacos and coffee in there - really great spacious place
It's so Charlotte..  Cool spot
Enjoyed some really delicious coffee from here one Saturday morning. Their menu also looked good so we are saving it for another day.

Killer Coffee has become of my top favorite coffee places lately. As a coffee enthusiast I was hesitant on how good it would be being in a brewery, but after a long wait for the next door restaurant, figured it wouldn't hurt to step in. Really glad we did, the pastries are tasty and the coffee was on point.
Lost & found >

Best thing about this place is the coffee and tacos. Other than that, overpriced drinks and always a long line. Heavy ego'd crowd on the weekend nights, I thin kI stopped like three fights by simply pretending to know the potential victim & apologizing. (I'm a taller bigger guy and tend to look like security lol) still don't know all the hype around this place but probably will only get coffee if I'm around.
Great place. Brought my pup

Staff was great! You could see owner and management active and engaging which really showed in the service provided. The brunch fries were incredible!
The chorizo sandwich was refreshingly light.
Chips and queso were good.
Drinks left a lot to be desired.
Great atmosphere!
It's a great atmosphere.
Company party of 500+. No problem and great!!! Food drinks staff and entertainment excellent!!!
Club vibe, not a brewery vibe. Great spot though, and the best beer at a "club" you're going to get in Charlotte.
It's set up with a bar and fast casual dining with a great atmosphere. The food and drinks are good.
This place gives incredible attention to detail in every aspect of their food and coffee. Easily some of the best coffee I've ever had.

I like the original brewery in plaza but the south end location is disappointing. Cocktail and wine selection is almost non-existent, and the ones you can get just don't taste good and don't nearly stand up to their price tags. The popularity of the brewery speaks to the fact that it's "trendiness" that bars in the Charlotte area strive for, over quality and creativity.
Good beer and lots of seats.  Service could have been a little faster, bartender was missing for 5 to 6 minutes at a time filing something off to the side. I would recommend all in all
Good times but $14.29 (without tip) for a small Tito's and soda was way too much. We're not in Miami.

Pretty good, high on flavor and texture, low on portion. Coffee is good.

I'd eat it again, but I hope they add a larger breakfast burrito to the lineup.
The coffee is indeed killer. The breakfast tacos are amazing. Come in for coffee and a taco and stay for the great space to work in.
Second stop for the night and it was a cool vibe with great people to hang out with.
It's a brewery...wait for it...and a nightclub. Prepare to be searched if you go while it's busy. They got liquor.
Had an amazing time! Love the location and hanging out at the bar. Pang was so attentive to our needs and made sure we were well taken care of!

Review for killer coffee:

Sublime coffee shop located inside resident culture. Great coffee and tacos to enjoy before it's time to have a beer.

I ordered a latte and a chorizo taco. It's pretty popular here, so the wait was longer than I had expected, but once they arrived, it was top notch all the way around. The latte was smooth with a slightly bitter kick, just the way I like. The taco was a good size for the price, and the chorizo, while a bit greasy, was popping with flavor and blended well with the egg and cheese, and the tortilla was quite enjoyable as well.

Definitely a good place to stop for coffee in south end!

Bonus coffee bar in the back! Come during the day for some chill vibes and free wifi.

This is my go-to spot for a mobile workspace; order up a velvety coffee, from scratch breakfast burrito, and set up in the open, plant-filled atmosphere.

There's even a unique vending machine with quirky trinkets and local art!

I'm definitely coming back again, it's a well executed breakfast workplace.

The beer is incredible but I recently found out they have breakfast and coffee, KILLER COFFEE, and it has now become my regular coffee/remote work spot. Tons of seating in the taproom and free wifi.

The dirty horchata with a chorizo breakfast taco is always the move! Love having a solid coffee spot near my office in South End that isn't a sit down restaurant!
Coffee and tacos are great.
Nice spot to grab some coffee and get work done. Lots of seating as well.
Love getting my coffee and breakfast from here. Everyone is super polite and welcoming. Have yet to get anything bad on the menu. Highly recommend to anyone who loves coffee and good food.
The door was locked at 9 pm despite their posted hours are 10 pm. I was told we "snuck in" when I entered at 9. Not true to their posted hours and bad quality of service
Love this place! Friendly convenient table service, great beer (and cocktails!) and excellent casual Mexican tapas and taco options.
Food is above average

Great tacos! Its not people friendly due to ordering from QR code. Would rate more if had the option to order from a person to ask questions about the food and beer. Beer menu was there via lcd screen prior to ordering via online. Good for the local who knows the place! First timer not so friendly!
Always have you double check my tab here
Barbacoa breakfast tacos are the best and great toast.

Breakfast menu is amazing. Breakfast tacos, waffles and the mushroom toast were all very flavorful. Great coffee and espresso drinks. Staff is super attentive and friendly. We were on a tight schedule and the staff was helpful in getting our food fast and then helping us wrap up. We will definitely be back.

Good variety of drinks, and had a great time at the drag brunch. Could use better integration of thier food, and maybe look at better outside tables. The ones they have are a bit uncomfortable. But otherwise, a pretty great place.
Bouncers are super sensitive and will kick you out if you tell them their breath stinks.
Great music!!
Staff was super attentive at the bar and beer was good. Ordered Chips and guac and it hit the spot!

Resident Culture is one of my absolute favorite places in Charlotte. If you like great beer, Tacos, and a wonderful time, this is the place for you. The tap selection is always incredible, they go above and beyond to make sure there is a beer on tap for everyone. If you happen to not be a beer fan, they have some great options for mixed drinks as well.

The new DJ on Saturday nights is not very good. She kept playing old school hip hop over and over again. I don't come to this place to listen to "walk it like I talk it" Friends also will not be back until they change the songs and vibe.
I really like this place! Super cool vibes, good beer (try the sour) and their glasses are the cutest!

Went last night (a Friday), prior to the drinking crowd. Got there around 830ish. Apparently they stop serving food at 8, but the bartender sympathized and let me order anyway -- I guess because it was pretty slow. (Thanks again)

Al Pastor tacos were DELICIOUS. Chips and queso wasn't bad, but the chips were definitely over salted.

Vibe was cool, beer was good, made some new friends. Had a great time. Probably about 10 it started picking up and by 11 there was a line out the door.

<>

Also been here once before with the drinking crowd and it was alright. Certainly a crowded place, but I found I prefer coming here when it isn't super loud. It's a good "pregame" place for me.

Obsessed with this place for breakfast, brunch and lunch. Amazing coffee, killer breakfast and regular tacos, great queso, gauc and salsa, AND delicious beer and cocktails. Everything is ready within minutes.

We always bring our dog and baby and sit outside, no wait in the weekends, and everyone is so nice.  Can't be beat!
Lots of space and chill atmosphere.  Great coffee and some good breakfast food in the morning.  Parking is hard to find.

We had our Rehearsal Dinner at RC, and we couldn't asked for a more fun and well put together event, and an excellent time was had by all of our guests!  The beer and food (from El Toro Bruto) were excellent, and the wait staff were always on hand making sure guests never had an empty glass! The planning was straightforward and low stress thanks to our coordinator, Emily. Pricing was clear and up front, while at the same time, we had tremendous flexibility in putting together a food and beverage package that worked for us. We couldn't recommend it more!

Clever ordering system that uses a QR on the table and you purchase your food and drinks in an app. Then it gets delivered to your table. I had delicious Al Pastor tacos and some tasty Kombucha. I'm not a beer drinker but there was a good selection of different ales and layers

Disappointing really. Went to RC recently with a big group and was not impressed at all. Being a regular at reputable places around Charlotte, I expected a higher level of personalized customer service than what RC had to offer. The door staff treats patrons as if they are TSA and will find any reason to deny entry. While my friends and I made it in without issues, many other prospective patrons did not. Once inside, you enter the land of try hards and ballers on a budget. Cocktails are about as good as one could make themselves and their liquor selection was nonexistent. The only reason this place got 2 instead of 1 star is because the bartender was very friendly. Don't come here. Don't waste your money. South end has so much more to offer and RC is definitely the bottom tier.

RC is somewhat the new guy on the block. Loud and fun dance music consistently. Pretty decent DJs and sound system in there. Long lines are the biggest problem they have after 9:30. Entry line, bar line, and women's restroom line can all take well over 20 mins depending on the foot traffic. That and slightly pricy drinks are enough to make me hesitate running back there. Overall I enjoy my time and I'm glad it's moved to South End.

Music & Atmosphere 5/5
Restroom access 3/5
Bar access 2/5 (after 10pm)

By far my favorite brewery in Southend! Excellent beers on tap, and a full bar for non beer lovers. Amazing tacos if you're hungry, and an almost nightclub feeling after dark. Definitely great place to hang out and be social!
The ordering situation is really weird.

Went in to listen to the Girls Room DJs and have a drink on Sunday and was treated rudely and nearly assaulted by the staff. Was yelled and cursed at by the bartender because he couldn't understand my simple drink order over the loud music. When I refused to leave a tip, the bartender dumped out my drinks without refunding my money. He then aggressively escorted me out. It felt like I would have been assaulted if I had given any resistance or tried to get the credit card charge refunded.

Please don't mistake this as a Resident Culture taproom. It's basically a club - a la Lost and Found - with some beer taps and food. Which honestly I expected, but I did NOT expect to get treated that way.
Great beer and great tacos.  The taco Tuesday deals is amazing.   Any beer and two tacos for $10.
super photogenic venue- however never tends to get filled up like the other bars/ clubs surrounding it. this place is just more of a chill bar spot

Security was absolutely terrible, I'm writing a Google review but feel like I should be writing a police statement. Watched a security guard Slam a young girl on the ground like a rag doll.  It was horrendous, unjustifiable actions I witnessed. He looked satisfied from his Sadistic actions. Can't believe what happened, watched this poor girl limp away confussed as I was why someone would do this. Highly recommend staying away from this place.

Worst people ever. This place is garbage. The security literally just grabbed my friend and threw my friend away because she was blocking a way? What type of person treat a woman like that way? My friend twisted her ankle because of this security guy, he was black and had dread hair. He needs to learn how to treat people right. He deserves to be in jail for throwing A GIRL on a street. Now my friend is on crutches. If you are a manager to this restaurant, start training your securities. This is beyond absurd and we will press charges.

I wish I could leave 0. We were here this past weekend for a bachelorette party and were making our way out to leave and stopped for a brief moment to pet a dog that was in the bar and security came up and was like you need to move you're blocking the walkway, we went on to apologize and leave and one of the security guards picked my friend up from her shoulders and ran her outside and threw her on the sidewalk. She now can't walk and is on crutches. I would love for the manager to contact us. This is unlawful and horrible behavior!

The security has a lack of communication and tries to start arguments in order to kick the guys out that came in with a group. Our group tried to move a table and we were told that we had to speak with management. Before we could walk away a male from our group was grabbed and yelled at for moving the table. The security escalated a small situation to a much larger situation and continued to try to kick the males from our group out. I do not recommend going here with a group as security will target males in order to keep the male to guy ratio. Management agreed to let us move the table but the security team is way to aggressive to ever have a group go to Residence Culture.
Really fun atmosphere! The beer and cocktail options are awesome. The food is amazing and very happy with the different size options. One of my favorite  places I've been to in Charlotte.

Okay, the ordering system is the best!  Scan a QR code, choose what you want and everything magically appears a moment later. The staff are nice, the food is good, but why hasn't every restaurant implemented this technology???

Drinks were lousy. You're paying for the cool location and being around 21-26 year olds. Went for Cinco De Mayo and was severely disappointed. I've had better margaritas at Chili's. They honestly liked sugar water with cheap tequila. Will not be coming back anytime soon
The staff was so amazing. The beer was epic. Definitely worth the drive
Great atmosphere on Friday and Saturday nights. Line to get in takes a long time, same with getting a drink

Wouldn't let my friends and coworkers come in even though they were literally 2 minutes behind me because apparently they don't let anyone in past a certain time. By this time we had bought shots and drinks for the rest of the group and had to give half of them away. Won't be spending my money here again.

I see this more as a destination/entertainment brewery. No flights available but at the slow time I was allowed to taste several beers.  Smallest pour was about 9 oz.  Friendly staff but I could see this place packed on a weekend that might dampen or enhance your experience.   The beers were tasty.

Shut the doors at 1:30am last night and pushed everyone out.

Close at 11:00 like most breweries if you can't handle the crowd till 2am.
Beer was ok, queso was horrible.
Love the beer. The location is great with plenty of space and picnic tables in the alley. Will definitely come back to this location!
Extremely popular place among locals. Loud music and usually overcrowded. It feels like it is a club rather than a brewery.
Great beers quick service sitting at the bar.
Very nicely done remodel of an old industrial shop for the South End location of this brewery. Open space plus outdoor areas too. Of course, the beers are the stars of the show here.

This new building is a wonderful addition to the Charlotte Resident Culture collection and fits well into the S Mint Str area. It has a very vibrant energetic aesthetic and the crowd was hopin' even on midweek. Nice wide selection of drafts and, uncommon for a brewery taproom, there is tasty southwestern street taco and burrito selections available on-site. I'd highly recommend checking this place out.
Resident cultures 2nd location.. great beer, serves liquor, big space, outside patio. Good service will be back
Cool taproom. As always best local beer in town. Outdoor seating. Dj booth!

Beer is okay at best, but the service is weirdly aggressive. No host will actually seat you but they will not hesitate to yell at you if you are in their way. The guy patrolling the corridor from the useless hostess stand to the back to the bar is the rudest server I've encountered in south end in 5 years. Told us to move 5 feet away and then told us that wasn't where he wanted us to go  boy make up your mind??

I threw an event for my husband's birthday at RC South End, and I have nothing but wonderful things to say.
1. First off, the Event Manager Emily Cole is a dream to work with. She was so accommodating and was present the entire day for any questions or requests. We also had to reschedule last minute due to Covid, and she helped us reschedule with ease.
2. The new space is also BEAUTIFUL and lively and fun. We booked the private room, which was spacious and had a ton of natural light. They had a really cool drink ordering system that brought us drinks so we didn't have to wait in line at the bar.
3. Drinks and food were great. This isn't shocking coming from Resident Culture.
4. There's a beautiful event space coming downstairs for any brides looking to get married in South End!

Looking forward to making this a regular spot. We will definitely look to book another event there soon. Thank you Emily and Resident Culture!
Aahhmazing! Best staff, food, drinks are amazing. Doesnt get better!
The food and drinks were great, the atmosphere is very lively, and the service was the fastest service I have ever had!!
Very good beers. Not much vegetarian or vegan options for tacos. I had Napoles tacos and those were really good. It gets messy but they have me extra tortilla to make another taco with it.

Resident Culture just recently opened. So fairly new spot but the atmosphere on a Saturday night is amazing. Everyone is having a good time dancing , drinking , socializing, eating tacos( Toro buto) or all of the above. Also, they have a movable POS which is nice for processing customers fast.  You have to be 21+ to get in (at night) . There's enough room for everyone. They have tables on the main floor , at the back of the main floor and outdoor sitting too. Going to the restroom, they have a Disco ball spinning that's pretty cool. The DJ is on point with the music selection . Menu of their drinks on the TV. I'll say it like a mini optimist Hall but without the multiple food outlets. Overall, great experience. It's a spot to chill let loose with great friends.
Atmosphere was really cool. DJ was hot and the tacos were really fresh!
Cool new spot! Tasty beer, and nice crew! No onsite parking, but area is walkable.
Great vibes and atmosphere, delicious beer and outstanding tacos. I recommend the carne asada.

It's ironic the location of this Taco Shop is on Bland Street, because that is precisely how I would describe the tacos and chips/queso we ordered.  This place will do great in Southend given the generally basic tastes of the clientele.

Resident Culture pulls it off.
Well adapted for the south end crowd. And while I'll be at the plaza location much more often due to proximity, this south end spot is incredible. Great tacos, even better Brutos- can't wait for Mostra.

Is it busy? Yes. But it's south end, so expect it and get over it. I went on opening weekend and had fantastic service, beer and cocktails were on point.

Congrats to everyone involved in opening a very cool spot.
Better places to hang in the South End. Do not recommend. Other Resident Culture location better way more laid back.

Loved the tacos. I tried the Nopal taco (10/10). The cocktails were great. Awesome atmosphere and the service was super sweet. They were a little behind at the grand opening but it was expected. A lot of people have been waiting for the opening so its understandable that the line was long. I was hyped to go and I wasn't disappointed. The scan to pay for your order is a great idea because when you are finished, you close your tab and leave. Overall, 10/10

Great place. Amazing food. Quality service. Some reviews say that the wait was long but that's normal at a grand opening.
I love how convenient it was to order tacos from El Toro Bruto by just scanning the QR code and keeping the tab open.
Excellent experience!

I went to the grand opening, and will give this place a grain of salt. There was a line out the door, about a 30 minute wait. When we were able to go in, it was quite busy inside with not enough seating. However the decorations are quite modern and colorful.

The taco place was hard to find as there isn't obvious signage and there is no physical place to order. You have to order through their website/QR code. They text you when your order is ready, but it wasn't obvious, so I thought I might have missed my order. It took about 40 minutes to receive my food after ordering. The tacos are really really good though. They're about $3.50 each and are just solid street tacos.

The wait for the beer wasn't too bad, but I did see long lines later in the night. There's one main bar and a smaller bar towards the back. I ordered a Mexican lager and it was pretty good standard beer.

We luckily found a table, but I experienced sensory overload. There was a lot of people, but the acoustics of the place amplified the sound. The colorful decorations could also be much after a while. I recommend going when it is not busy if you are sensitive to loud sounds and colors/lights. The wait staff was attentive and the place itself was clean.

Overall, a nice addition to the breweries in South end!
